title: The Uncommon Reader
author: Alan Bennett
summary: Queen Elizabeth II comes across a travelling library and it ignites a love of reading

title: Kill River
author: Cameron Roubique
summary: Teenagers sneak away from a summer camp to explore a water park and find themselves being hunted down

title: Things Have Gotten Worse Since We Last Spoke
author: Eric LaRocca
summary: Two lonley women meet in a chat room and they succumb to horrific desires
review: Eh. It starts off pretty good but progresses into a half baked plot and then ends kind of abruptly. Almost like the author lost interest and just wanted to wrap it up. Very shallow, written purely for the shock value I think

title: The Route of Ice and Salt
author: José Luis Zárate
review:
This is one of those books that not everyone is going to love. The first half of the book has a dream like quality to it, and is mostly the erotic desire of a queer male sea captain. It's his private diary of thoughts and desire leading up to the end. It gets reasonably graphic, but not overly so in my opinion. The second half of the book is a more factual journal of events, a captain's log of sorts. It was almost like reading two completely different books with the same premise.

The Route of Ice and Salt was a really well written book that conjured up a lot of imagery and sold the story of the sea captain really well. However, I found it really hard to get through, and I almost didn't finish it several times. I think this is because what the book was, and what I was expecting the book to be were two different things. I'm giving it three stars for being well written but also because I didn't love it, but I didn't hate it either.

title: Ark
author: Veronica Roth
summary: On the eve of earths destruction, a young scientist discovers something too precious to lose.

title: Summer Frost
author: Blake Crouch
summary: A video game developer becomes obsessed with a willful character in her new project

title: Emergency Skin
author: N. K. Jemisin
summary: An explorer returns to gather information from a climate-ravaged earth that his ancestors fled centuries ago.

title: You Have Arrived at Your Destination
author: Amor Towles
summary: When Sam's wife first tells him about Vitek, a 21st century fetiliity lab, he sees it as the next step in helping his child get a leg up. But the more he consideres the more he begins to question his own relationships and the choices he has made in life.

title: The Last Conversation
author: Paul Tremblay
summary: Imagine waking up in an unfamiliar room with no memory of who you are or how you got there. All you have is the disconnected voice of Dr Kuhn, who is there to help you remember everything. But are you sure you want to?

title: Randomize
author: Andy Weir
summary: In the near future an IT whiz athe Babylon Casino is enlisted to upgrade security for the game of keno and its random number generator. The new quantum computer is foolproof. But someone on the inside is no fool and the odds may not be favour the house.

title: Finna
author: Nino Cipri
summary: When an elderly customer at a big box furniture store slips through a portal to another dimension, it's up to two minimum-wage employees to track her across the multiverse and protect their company's bottom line.

title: Everything My Mother Taught Me
author: Alice Hoffman
summary: In 1900 a young woman goes missing and the only witness is Adeline, who has vowed to never speak a word.

title: The Three Secret Cities
author: Matthew Reilly
summary: When Jack West Jnr won the great games, he threw the four legendary kingdoms into turmoil, now these dark forces are coming after Jack. With the end of all things approaching, Jack must find the Three Secret Cities.

title: Clowns Vs. Spiders
author: Jeff Strand
summary: A group of clowns take work in the popular haunted attraction, the Mountains of Terror. On opening night, millions of oversized spiders emerge from a cave and begin their deadly invasion.

title: Hide
author: Kiersten White
summary: Mack signs up for a competition with a huge payday. It sounds easy - spend the a week hiding in an abandoned amusement park and don't get caught. But Mack soon realises the competition is more sinister than she imagined.

title: The Summer Is Ended and We Are Not Yet Saved
author: Joey Comeau
summary: Martin is going to Bible Camp for the summer. He's going to learn archery and swimming, and he's going to make new friends. He's pretty excited, but that's probably because nobody told him that this is a horror novel.

title: From Below
author: Darcy Coats
summary: Cove and her dive team have been granted permission to explore the Arcadia's rusting hull. Their purpose is straightforward: examine the wreck, film everything, and, if possible, uncover how and why the supposedly unsinkable ship vanished. But something dark and hungry watches from below. With limited oxygen and the ship slowly closing in around them, Cove and her team will have to fight their way free of the unspeakable horror now desperate to claim them

title: The Cipher
author: Isabella Maldonado
summary: FBI Special Agent Nina Guerrera escaped a killer at age 16 and now he is back, determined to reclaim his prize. Drawing her into his game, she tracks him across the country, clue by clue, victim by victime, she races to stop him.

title: The Nice House on the Lake
author: James Tynion IV
series: The Nice House on the Lake
summary: Walter invites a group of friends to his secluded home in the woods, but what they find there may just be the end of all of them

title: The Wonderful Wizard of Oz
author: L. Frank Baum
summary: Dorothy and her dog, Toto are transported to a magic world where she finds friends who accomany her on her jounry to see the great and powerful Oz.

title: Legends & Lattes
author: Travis Baldree
summary: A battle-weary orc aims to start fresh, opening the first ever coffee shop in the city of Thune.

title: The Thursday Murder Club
author: Richard Osman
summary: In a retirement village, four friends meet up once a week to investigate unsolved killings. But when a local property developer turns up dead the Thursday Murder Club find themselves in the middle of a live case. Can they catch the killer before its too late?

title: Dead Silence
author: S. A. Barnes
summary: Claire and her team investigate a mysterious distress signal in space. What they find is the luxury space liner Aururoa which dissapeared 20 years ago. But as they explore the ship, something isn't right, can they find out what happened to the ship while keeping their sanity?

author: Adam Kay

title: Adrift in Currents Clean and Clear
author: Seanan McGuire

author: Daryl Gregory
